channel.title: SevenAtSevenPolitics
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from SevenAtSevenPolitics, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Gaetz sues to block release of Ethics Committee report
item.description: Former Rep. Matt Gaetz, R-Fla., filed a lawsuit Monday in an attempt to block the release of a House Ethics Committee report on his alleged behavior.

item.title: Congress Is a Living Advertisement for Term Limits
item.description: The senility of too many powerful leaders in Washington is a silent scandal.

item.title: Musk urges Bezos to throw an ‘epic wedding’ after Amazon founder blasts report of $600 million nuptials as ‘completely false’
item.description: Bezos flatly denied a report he would marry fiancée Lauren Sánchez the weekend after Christmas in a lavish ceremony in Aspen.

item.title: No, Christmas Is Not ‘What You Make It’
item.description: The meaning of Christmas is not in us or anything we do. It is only in Christ and what He did.

item.title: Half of companies with office space say leases are affecting their RTO policies
item.description: Companies say they want to increase worker collaboration productivity, but many leaders are also influenced by existing office leases.

item.title: Editor’s Picks: Top 3 Book Reviews of 2024 and a Sneak Peek at 2025
item.description: What books reviewed in 2024 stand out for their applicability to practical issues confronting investment decision-makers?

item.title: Many Americans rely on Chinese-made drones that lawmakers want to ban
item.description: Russell Hedrick, a North Carolina farmer, flies drones to spray fertilizers on his corn, soybean and wheat fields at a fraction of what it would cost ...

item.title: Ex-Pence press secretary Katie Miller tapped to serve in DOGE
item.description: President-elect Donald Trump announced Sunday that Katie Miller will be joining the newly-created Department of Government Efficiency.

item.title: The GOP Needs to Stay on Offense on Corporate Tax Reform
item.description: Now is not the time for Republican tax writers to rest on their 2017 laurels.

item.title: Retiring GOP congresswoman's decline has been 'very rapid,' son says

item.title: Trump’s demand for control of Greenland is immediately rejected
item.description: Greenland’s PM: “Greenland is ours. We are not for sale and will never be for sale.”

item.title: How To Enjoy This Christmas If You’re A Trump Hater (Or If You Sadly Know One)
item.description: Whether you hate Trump or just know someone who does, it's possible to still have a merry Christmas. Here are tips for both.

item.title: Nebraska governor hospitalized after being bucked off horse
item.description: Nebraska Gov. Jim Pillen was injured Sunday after being bucked off a horse and is expected to be hospitalized for several days.

item.title: The Enterprise Approach for Institutional Investors
item.description: What is an enterprise approach to investment management, and why should it be a staple on any institutional investor's task list?

item.title: Voter Confidence Is Up Because Election Integrity Was Back In 2024
item.description: Most voters say the November elections were administered well in their communities and nationally, a Pew Research Center survey finds.

item.title: End Medicaid’s Mission Creep
item.description: The program has grown beyond its original purpose in ways that foster dependency and place unsustainable burdens on taxpayers and state budgets.

item.title: Trump defends Elon Musk, addresses 'ceded the presidency' chatter
item.description: President-elect Donald Trump pushed back on claims that tech billionaire Elon Musk has been moving in to take his position as president.

item.title: How Making Christmas Cookies Can Remind Us Of Our Creator And Reflect Him To The World
item.description: However poor an imitation we are, we are living, breathing reflections of our creative, beautiful, unchanging, patient, hospitable Savior.

item.description: Understanding the historical context of financial markets is crucial for investment professionals seeking to make informed decisions in today’s comple...

item.title: The alleged online smear campaign against Blake Lively is a reminder of how eager society is to ‘hate on women’
item.description: The "It Ends With Us" actress was likely the victim of an online smear campaign.

item.title: Surging cases and lagging vaccines: Why this U.S. flu season has experts worried
item.description: Thirteen states reported high or very high levels of flu-like illness last week, about double from the week before.

item.title: Someone Please Tell The Washington Post The Real Meaning Of Christmas Is Not Self-Care
item.description: Christmas is for celebrating the arrival of the Savior of the world, not for ‘celebrating and luxuriating’ in your ‘holiday aloneness.'

item.title: WFB: Big, and Glorious
item.description: William F. Buckley Jr. was a man of parts.

item.title: A Washington Giveaway to Government Workers
item.description: The Social Security Fairness Act checks all the boxes of bad legislation.

item.title: Panama's president hits back at Trump idea to reclaim key canal
item.description: Panama President José Raúl Mulino responded Sunday to President-elect Trump's idea to regain control of the Panama Canal expressed over the weekend.

item.title: Nebraska Gov. Jim Pillen hospitalized after he was bucked off a horse
item.description: Nebraska Gov. Jim Pillen was injured and transported to a hospital on Sunday after he was bucked off a horse while he was riding with his family.
